etymology.description: 大(big) + 白(white) + 菜(vegetable) = big white vegetable (Chinese cabbage).
etymology.interpretation: Literally names the pale, elongated cabbage common in North China; contrasts with 小白菜, which refers to bok choy/Shanghai pak choi.

examples.chinese: 我买了一颗大白菜(我買了一顆大白菜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yì kē dà báicài.
examples.english: I bought a head of Chinese cabbage.

examples.chinese: 大白菜可以炒着吃(大白菜可以炒著吃)，也可以做泡菜(也可以做泡菜)。
examples.pinyin: Dà báicài kěyǐ chǎo zhe chī, yě kěyǐ zuò pàocài.
examples.english: Chinese cabbage can be stir-fried, and it can also be made into pickles.

examples.chinese: 北方冬天常腌大白菜(北方冬天常醃大白菜)。
examples.pinyin: Běifāng dōngtiān cháng yān dà báicài.
examples.english: In northern China, people often pickle Chinese cabbage in winter.
